kaninator.game
Class Model

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.game.Model

public class Model
extends java.lang.Object

Contains all the relevant methods for moving a model around in the game. Used to strap physics and controllable movement onto a DynamicObject.

See Also:
DynamicObject

Constructor Detail

Model

public Model(java.util.ArrayList<Animation> animations,
             Map _map,
             double x,
             double y,
             double radius_constant,
             double speed)
      throws ModelException
Constructs a model from the animations given in the parameters. Creates a couple of DynamicObjects that correspond to the model, ie. a DynamicObject for the animation itself and one for the shadow connected to the model.

Parameters:
animations - The ArrayList of Animations that build up the model itself, cannot be null or of the size 0.
_map - The map used for collision detection and height checking.
x - The initial x coordinate for the model in the internal, isometric coordinate system.
y - The initial y coordinate for the model in the internal, isometric coordinate system.
radius_constant - How much the width of the Animations should be divided with to get a realistic estimate for the radius of the model.
speed - The speed the model will be moving at in isometric coordinates.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the animation is null or of the size 0, since the model cannot be created without these.
ModelException
Method Detail

update

public void update()
Updates the model, in essence checking for collisions, moving it into the correct direction and moving the shadow correspondingly.

move_x

public void move_x(int direction)
Sets the speed on the internal, isometric, x-axis for the object.

Parameters:
direction - 0 if there is no movement. Negative if the movement is in the negative direction. Positive if the movement is in the positive direction.

move_y

public void move_y(int direction)
Sets the speed on the internal, isometric, y-axis for the object.

Parameters:
direction - 0 if there is no movement. Negative if the movement is in the negative direction. Positive if the movement is in the positive direction.

setVelX

public void setVelX(double _vel_x)
Sets the velocity on the internal, isometric, x-axis without any regard to the speed attribute of the model.

Parameters:
_vel_x - The new velocity on the x-axis

setVelY

public void setVelY(double _vel_y)
Sets the velocity on the internal, isometric, y-axis without any regard to the speed attribute of the model.

Parameters:
_vel_y - The new velocity on the y-axis

Getter for the velocity on the x-axis for the model

The velocity on the x-axis.

getVelY

public double getVelY()
Getter for the velocity on the y-axis for the model

Returns:
The velocity on the y-axis.

jump

public void jump()
Makes the model jump according to its jumpSpeed. Jumps only happen if the model is on the ground and not already moving vertically.

getState

public int getState()
Gets the state of the model. In essence which animation it is currently drawing.

Returns:
The state of the model.

setState

public void setState(int _state)
Sets the state of the model. In essence which animation it is currently drawing.

Parameters:
_state - The state of the model.

advanceAnimation

public void advanceAnimation()
Advances the currently active Animation.

See Also:
Animation.advance()

reset

public void reset()
Resets the currently active Animation.

See Also:
Animation.reset()

getModel

public DynamicObject getModel()
Gets the DynamicObject representing the model, collision detection is usually performed against this object.

Returns:
The main DynamicObject

getDynamicObjects

public java.util.LinkedList<DynamicObject> getDynamicObjects()
Gets all the DynamicObjects associated with the model. Ie. The model itself and its shadow.

Returns:
A LinkedList of all the DynamicObjects associated with the model.
